III. INVESTIGATION

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A former staff member had sexual relations with Youth A during
his placement at the facility.
Investigation Contact with the Complainant did not occur after attempts made
on 07/26/2024, 07/29/2024, 07/31/2024, 08/02/2024, and
08/13/2024.
The Program Director was interviewed during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit to the facility on 05/28/2024. This occurred with
DHHS Worker 1 on the phone. Program Director confirmed that
Intern 1 had worked at the facility through her Master’s in Social
Work program from September 2023 through April 2024 and had
not had any contact with anyone at the program since that time.
Program Director shared that allegations involving Youth A and
Intern 1 had just come to light and he was not aware of any similar
concerns prior. Documentation from Intern 1's personnel file was
shared. DHHS Worker 1 confirmed that a Child Advocacy Center
(CAC) interview would take place for Youth A the following week
and travel arrangements were made to ensure his attendance.
The Program Director did not express any concerns with Intern 1’s
work at the facility.
An interview with Youth A at a Child Advocacy Center was
scheduled for 06/03/2024. Youth A arrived at the interview and
declined to participate or speak about anything regarding the
allegations for this investigation. Youth A left the interview
location with facility staff without adding any additional information.
DHHS Worker 1 shared that, at this time, Law Enforcement had
not provided direction on their possible investigation of Intern 1
and the allegations.
2

During a video conference on 06/21/2024 DHHS Worker 1
provided an update on her investigation and was not able to state
the final result. DHHS Worker 1 confirmed at that time, local Law
Enforcement had not pursued their investigation further based on
Youth A not providing an interview regarding the allegations.
Youth B was interviewed over the phone on 07/26/2024. He
stated he had been in the same unit as Youth A for a long period
of time when Youth A was placed at the facility. Youth B recalled
hearing Youth A comment on female staff members often in
inappropriate ways. He also recalled Youth A stating he wanted
to have sex with Intern 1, but he was not sure if Youth A ever
stated this actually occurred. Youth B recalled Youth A commonly
stating he was attracted to Therapist 1. Youth B recalled there
was a common concern that Youth A often lied about past
interactions with other youth and staff, and Youth A would
commonly make inappropriate sexual remarks about others.
Therapist 1 was interviewed over the phone on 07/26/2024. She
stated she had worked with Youth A during direct therapy services
until the month prior to his discharge from the program. Therapist
1 stated she never had direct concerns with Youth A, but she was
aware of Youth A making inappropriate comments about herself
and other female staff outside of her sessions with him. Therapist
1 stated she was aware of a significant amount of past sexualized
behavior from Youth A, both prior to his placement in November
2023, and while placed at the facility. Therapist 1 stated Youth A
told her directly about alleged sexual contact between he and
Intern 1. She stated this occurred after a session in late May.
Therapist 1 stated she had already had a concern that Youth A
had a "crush" on Intern 1 prior to this, based on his behaviors in
Intern 1's presence. Therapist 1 stated Youth A sought her out
after a session had ended and he whispered to her that he and
Intern 1 had kissed on one occasion. Therapist 1 stated Youth A
then shared details of the alleged encounter, including that Youth
A and Intern 1 snuck away to an office in a separate building on
one occasion and had sex in a room with lit candles. Therapist 1
did not have any concerns to report about Intern 1. Therapist 1
stated she told the Clinical Director about these details
immediately after her conversation with Youth A and she and the
Clinical Director discussed how to properly report these concerns
where it was necessary.
Intern 1 was interviewed over the phone on 07/26/2024. Intern 1
denied the allegations that she had sex with Youth A and stated
she never had any inappropriate contact with him during her time
3

working at the facility or since that work had ended. Intern 1
stated her work with Youth A occurred during group sessions with
other youth at the program. She stated she did not see him
individually for any therapy sessions. Intern 1 stated there were
two times that she met with Youth A individually, but it was not for
any therapeutic work, it was for case management related work.
Intern 1 believed both of those interactions were brief and
occurred in the clinical building of the facility with many other staff
and youth present. Intern 1 stated Youth A never said anything of
a sexual nature towards her during her time in his presence, but
she did recall he stated other inappropriate things towards her.
On one occasion she recalled Youth A asking if her "body shape
was natural." On another occasion near the end of her time at the
facility, Youth A made a comment about wanting her phone
number so he could contact her after she was gone and after he
was discharged from the program. Intern 1 stated she did not
share any contact information with Youth A and had not had any
contact with him since her time at the program ended. Intern 1
stated she had told others within her educational program about
the uncomfortable feeling she had towards Youth A, but never
reported those concerns to facility staff while working in the
program.
Documents reviewed:
• The personnel file for Intern 1 was provided and reviewed.
Although not required through CCI rules, all normal
background checks that are required for full time employees
were performed for Intern 1 prior to her start date and no
concerning results were noted. Intern 1 was provided and
signed agreement to the facility's Ethical Standards of
Employees and Code of Conduct policies on 09/18/2023.
• The Foster Care case file for Youth A was reviewed. Youth
A has displayed a pattern of hyper-sexualized behaviors in
past placements and in school.
Analysis The facility was found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews, there was no evidence that Intern 1 had any
inappropriate contact with Youth A during her time working at the
facility.
Technical Assistance provided:
• The facility is advised to ensure that any future interns or
volunteers are directed to report any concerning behavior
within the facility itself in addition to any outside sources with
which they are affiliated.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
